1.a: He was confident that on that day Paul and his companions would be the reason for the pride of the Corinthian saints.

1.a: Paul said the were not trying to control what their faith should be, but they were working with the Corinthian church for their joy.

2.q: Why did Paul write this letter to the Corinthian church?

2.a: This was so that the one they had punished would not be overwhelmed by too much sorrow.
2.q: Why did Paul say the Corinthian saints should forgive and comfort the one they had punished?

2.a: Paul wrote to them to test them and to find out whether they were obedient in everything.

2.a: This was so that Satan would not trick them.

2.q: How did Paul say that he and his companions were different from many people who sold the word of God for profit?
